of the other leaders within amazon we're a bit inspired by sheryl sandberg's concept of lean in circles for women
this is for those of you that aren't familiar sort of an industry-wide initiative to support women in tech and
it brings together groups of individuals both experienced individuals and lesser
experienced individuals and they can learn from each other within a group and then also learn together as a group and
I really like that concept of group learning so more specifically though why
was amazon s3 interested in something like this so amazon has the concept of
flywheels this is something that our CEO Jeff Bezos has talked about in numerous
articles and this particular flywheel that you guys see up here is the Amazon
retail flywheel in terms of how does the retail business grow you start off with
a good selection of products and customers who go on to the website can
find what they're looking for because there's a good selection of products because they have a good experience they come back to the website they buy more
things they attract other people to the website and because there's good traffic on the website other sellers are
interested in selling more products on website and this is sort of the cycle to create more growth in the retail
workspace well within amazon s3 we were looking to grow something as well and we
were looking to grow innovators so everything that we do whether it's delivering new features to our customers
finding ways to reduce costs and pass those savings on to our customers everything that we do comes down to
innovations that we're driving and that's true in a lot of technical work spaces and so this was our flywheel to
find within the Amazon s3 sort of untapped potential to become great
innovators and so we start off in our circle here in our flywheel with career
development from existing innovators for other innovators and through that
process we can generate innovation leaders who create a lot of really cool things and people like to work for
people who are creating really cool things we can attract more innovators because they see those role models and
they want to work with them and they feel inspired by them and so we grow and we have more and more of these creative
individuals and innovators that are contributing to the growth of Amazon s3
so that's what we were looking for now what does that have to do with diversity

next you want to look at time and budget because this will take time this is time

participants to participate but they were supporting and encouraging them to participate in the diversity circle
another key thing for being a sponsor it helps if you have some experience coaching it is a type of group mentoring

then as a sponsor you also be kind of kicking things off and facilitating for

we were doing the circle that were important for us to be successful the first one was facilitating trust know
why is facilitating trust important in a circle I try to make an analogy here
that it's kind of like learning to drive a car when you're learning to drive a car you don't immediately head out to an
LA freeway or are that crazy thing I always see in Paris around the Arc de Triomphe you
don't immediately go there you start in someplace that's safe where you can't hurt someone you can't cause property
damage you can't cause expensive consequences maybe some place like an
empty parking lot where if you make a mistake it's really into consequential so that's what we were looking to create
for our career development growth experience we were looking for a safe environment where people could practice
skills where they could take a chance doing something that they hadn't done before and if they made a mistake it
really you know wasn't going to negatively impact things anyways and so we had to build that trust within the
team and build that trust well there was a couple things that are important you know investing some budget was key so
you can get some budget and doesn't have to be a lot to do fun things together to do things that really get people to open
up you know we did a lot of lunches together we did a lot of activities together we went blackberry picking

circle decide the approach that they wanted to take for the circle because the circle was really member led it was
not me you know running every session and doing everything and the participants being passive members they

and coaching sessions and so I spent a lot of prep time with the first couple of folks that led the sessions making

you can do that and others in the circle can follow from that example so here is

particular example we would bring in a video or an article we'd spend time
reviewing that material and then we would have a Q&A type discussion

Amazon Women's Circle team members really really enjoyed was bringing in
experienced folks from across amazon into the meeting and having them share
their experiences on some particular topic whether there's negotiation skills confidence their journey all sorts of

first one is really going back to what I talked about before and that's staying in touch with the participants managers
and the stakeholders that are interested and make sure that it's a successful circle a key
thing also is that as a sponsor you're going to maybe get exposure to people that you don't normally have exposure to

basis but i got to know their interests you know some of them were really interested in public speaking some of

you know I noted that our women really like the experienced individuals coming
in and sharing is very tangible and so going forward we tend to lean more towards those type of sessions a couple
of don'ts that we discovered along the way once we started the Amazon s3
women's circle there was a fair amount of buzz about it people are really excited they liked it and I started to
sort of be bombarded with a lot of requests of hey can this person in this person in this person join in the circle
and going back to that slide about trust it's kind of challenging as you have an
influx of constant new people to keep that safe environment for learning new
skills and so instead of constantly expanding the circle I have encouraged
people to start up new circles and I volunteered myself and other members within the circle to go sponsor new

why was I hesitant to ask them for help so I did I asked one of those young

there through the circle we learned that confidence is not just a feeling it's

and the behaviors that demonstrate confidence can be improved over time for

learned is that small changes in language can change how you are
